sect1.title: Bidirectional setup
sect1.para: Two groups of performance artists located in two separate venues interact directly with each other using live audio and video transmission. The performance in Room 1 is captured through cameras and microphones and sent to be broadcast in Room 2 and vice versa.

sect1.title: Audio input
sect1.para: The usual audio input is a microphone. This microphone is then connected in the input of an audio mixer and then to a sound card. This Sound card is then connected to the computer.
sect1.title: Audio output
sect1.para: The usual direct audio output is speakers or headphones.
sect1.title: Video Input
sect1.para: The usual direct video input is a video camera.
sect1.title: Video Output
sect1.para: The usual direct video output is a projection screen and an control monitor.

sect1.title: Starting the computer and its peripheral
sect1.para: With audio and video systems, the order used to powering up all device is really important.

listitem.para: Connect only, the mouse, keyboard and control monitor.
Connect the network cable on the network interface
Verify that you have sufficient power to supply your hardware. We strongly recommend the use of an UPS to regulate your power.
Power up the computer.
Verify that you log in the appropriate session.

Configure your network:
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/NetworkAdmin
Verify that your ip address is functional: In a terminal
ifconfig
You should see your address in the second line of your connected network interface:
eth0 Link encap:Ethernet HWaddr 00:30:1b:b4:af:a1
Then use ping
ping www.google.com
You should see something like this:
PING www.l.google.com (74.125.93.104) 56(84) bytes of data.
64 bytes from qw-in-f104.google.com (74.125.93.104): icmp_seq=1 ttl=239 time=36.2 ms
64 bytes from qw-in-f104.google.com (74.125.93.104): icmp_seq=2 ttl=239 time=37.3 ms
64 bytes from qw-in-f104.google.com (74.125.93.104): icmp_seq=3 ttl=239 time=36.4 ms
64 bytes from qw-in-f104.google.com (74.125.93.104): icmp_seq=4 ttl=239 time=36.1 ms
--- www.l.google.com ping statistics ---
4 packets transmitted, 4 received, 0% packet loss, time 3003ms
Open a terminal /Application/Accessories/Terminal
Verify that you are on the realtime kernel:
Type in a terminal
uname -r

You should see the -rt extension: 2.6.24-26-rt If not, you have to restart the computer. At the beginning of the reboot, you will see a grub window, press ESC and then select the kernel with the -rt extension.
Now you can close the computer.

Connect all the audio and video device following our
Hardware Setuppage.
While connecting the device, be aware that if you have two video output, you need to connect both of the output before powering up the computer again so that both devices are detected.

Next, configure and test your audio and video following our
TestAudiovisualInputOutputpage.
